channel.itunes:keywords: Waiheke Island Auckland New Zealand Community Radio station arts music interviews local content artists Artworks Oneroa culture
channel.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
channel.title: Waiheke Radio Podcasts
channel.description: All podcasts from community radio station Waiheke Radio. Aotearoa/New Zealand

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Can You Dig It?! - Episode 6: Compost
item.description: Kayleigh Appleton and Mike Fogarty from the Waiheke Resources Trust share tips for creating amazing compost at home.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Can You Dig It?! - Episode 5: Loloma Andrews
item.description: Chris walker talks to Loloma Andrews about public orchards and her home gardening. ![Orchard Bee](//images.ctfassets.net/muwn01agnrp5/2460ggpCbxnnSmSNpnpnW2/b6188f690f3eaf85e0553e7e2aa231a1/OrchardBee2.jpg)

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Can You Dig It?! - Episode 4: Eddie Welsh and The Reach Out Garden
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Eddie Welsh from Starter Plants who shares some tips on what to plant at this time of year and how to care for what you sow in this sweltering heat. Then he talks with Teresa Quinn from [Project Reach Out](https://reachoutwaiheke.org.nz/) who are growing produce to support mental health and social connection on Waiheke. ![Teresa Stall](//images.ctfassets.net/muwn01agnrp5/3ySEmPV5f5BZDDtynelujO/37abb9fabf719ed5e010fb4149ee7fa5/Teresa.jpg)![Cabbages](//images.ctfassets.net/m...

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Can You Dig It?! - Episode 3: Penny Holmes
item.description: Penny Holmes is an enthusiastic home and community gardener with invovlement in the [Home Grown Waiheke](https://www.homegrownwaiheke.nz/) Trust and Ostend Community Garden.![Ostend Community Garden](//images.ctfassets.net/muwn01agnrp5/6DNC0rAmqUf11LMu4HBjeE/e181a4b60f57589a774d8c7acaf41de8/20240118_115651.jpg)![Community Garden 1](//images.ctfassets.net/muwn01agnrp5/58YH6yngHK4qnUPUiEdmOt/97c2d2aba5948bc5a7e91dcdeafa7c77/20240118_115950.jpg)![Peaches](//images.ctfassets.net/muwn01agnrp5/4lz2hl...

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Can You Dig It?! - Episode 2: 18-01-2024
item.description: This episode's guest is Waiheke home garderner Holly Brown. She is growing incredible vegetable crops and flowers. Check out her Instagram account for beautiful photos of her garden and produce - [https://www.instagram.com/hollyamberbrown/](https://www.instagram.com/hollyamberbrown/) ![HB1](//images.ctfassets.net/muwn01agnrp5/3giJPeyGmM888SAvcyYS4l/f8236218638d32991420589ef0805d85/HB1.jpg)![HB2](//images.ctfassets.net/muwn01agnrp5/69SIlAPxYecp0InPZUupp7/554acb8919ca0c5289e786d5680a9e07/HB2.jpg)

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: WaiTalks 2023: Lucy Grace
item.description:
Lucy Grace was a guest speaker at WaiTalks 2023. An fundraising event for Talking Tree Hill and Nature2classroom’s research, programmes and well being days for the children and teachers of our Motu. The event was held at Morra Hall, Oneroa on 2nd Dec 2023. https://www.wai-talks.com/
Lucy's talk is preceded by her sharing a poem.
Lucy Grace is an internationally renowned Spiritual Teacher, Holistic Therapist and Poet. She has lived many lives – including as a television journalist for One News...

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: WaiTalks 2023: Jade Gray
item.description:
Jade Gray was a guest speaker at WaiTalks 2023. An fundraising event for Talking Tree Hill and Nature2classroom’s research, programmes and well being days for the children and teachers of our Motu. The event was held at Morra Hall, Oneroa on 2nd Dec 2023. https://www.wai-talks.com/
Jade Gray left New Zealand for China in 1996 with a smattering of Mandarin and a dream to make it in the worlds fastest growing economy. In a corporate career ranging from managing cattle breeding farms in the North...

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: WaiTalks2023: Mark Lapwood
item.description:
Mark Lapwood was a guest speaker at WaiTalks 2023. An fundraising event for Talking Tree Hill and Nature2classroom’s research, programmes and well being days for the children and teachers of our Motu. The event was held at Morra Hall, Oneroa on 2nd Dec 2023. https://www.wai-talks.com/
Mark Lapwood, an acclaimed cinematographer with over 25 years of professional experience, has made his mark in the world of documentaries, television commercials, music videos, and feature films.
He earned pre...

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: WaiTalks 2023: Michelle Hooper
item.description:
Michelle Hooper was a guest speaker at WaiTalks 2023. An fundraising event for Talking Tree Hill and Nature2classroom’s research, programmes and well being days for the children and teachers of our Motu. The event was held at Morra Hall, Oneroa on 2nd Dec 2023. https://www.wai-talks.com/
Michelle has a career spanning 25 years in the major international sporting events industry. Which has included delivering events for World Rugby, FIFA, the International Triathlon Union (ITU), the America’s C...

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: The Boy Who Ate Bugs
item.description: The Boy Who Ate Bugs was written and narrated by Waiheke writer Avi Duckor-Jones and was recorded and produced by Brent Simpson.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Can You Dig It?! Episode 1: 11 Jan 2024
item.description: Chris Walker talks with Eddie Welsh, who sells vege seedlings each Saturday at Ostand market, about what to plant in your home garden.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Interview with Susi Newborn Sept 2023
item.description: Interview with Susi Newborn from 22nd of September 2023 where she talks about being a protector, family, the history behind the rainbow warrior. It was such a honour to have Susi in Studio for this interview, she will be fondly remembered and missed by everyone whose life she touched.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Susi Newborn: Housing
item.description: Susi Newborn was a self proclaimed "lunatic and activist". She spent every moment of her life fighting to make the world a better place, with an unwavering commitment to addressing social justice and environmental issues locally and internationally. She sadly passed away on 31 Jan, 2023. Here she speaks with Greg Treadwell in 2017 about island housing Photo credit: Diana Worth/STUFF

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Susi Newborn: The Environment
item.description: Susi Newborn was a self proclaimed "lunatic and activist". She spent every moment of her life fighting to make the world a better place, with an unwavering commitment to addressing social justice and environmental issues locally and internationally. She sadly passed away on 31 Jan, 2023. Here she speaks at a 2015 Waitalks event about one of her great passions - the environment. Photo credit: ABIGAIL DOUGHERTY/STUFF

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Mana Mixtape interview with Teyo
item.description: Koro talks to Italian rapper Teyo

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Te Korowai o Waiheke rat trial update
item.description: Greg Treadwell talks to Owain Tanner from Te Korowai o Waiheke to get an update on the Oneroa rat eradication trial

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: The Wayup Interview: Bob Hewitt
item.description: Wayan and Jahn talk to New Yorker Bob Hewitt who has recently moved to Waiheke. They talk about the two books he's written about AI, his love of board games and the after school programme he set up in Brooklyn. They also talk about his plans for life on Waiheke Island.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Councillor Mike Lee
item.description: Chris Walker talks to councillor Mike Lee about the year since his re-election to Auckland Council and his decision to vote against the introduction of Māori wards. Photo credit: NZ Herald

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Crop Swap
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Hadas Ore about Waiheke Crop Swap. Home gardeners come together to swap their excess produce and share gardening tips.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Caulerpa Rahui
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Blair Anderson, Pou Rahui Project Manager for Ngāti Pāoa, about the rahui placed by the iwi to prevent the spread of the invasive Caulerpa seaweed.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Darleen Tana Elected To Parliament
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Darleen Tana whio has just been elected to parliament as a Green list MP

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Librarian Fiona Kralicek Resigning
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Fiona Kralicek who has been the head librarian at Waiheke Community Library for 28 years.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Emily King: The Wayup Interview
item.description: Wayan and Jahn from the Wayup show interview Emily King a local Surfdale resident about her latest book "Re-food" about New Zealands troubled food networks. The interview covers some of the challenges we face as a nation and how we can tackle them. Read more about Emily https://www.spira.nz/about

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Maia Piata Rose Week on the Maramataka
item.description: Koro talks to Maia Piata Rose Week about the Maramataka. Follow Maia on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/maia_moomies/

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: The Great Big Rescued Food Cook Off 2023
item.description: Koro talks to to Laura lynch and kayleigh Appleton from the Waiheke Resources Trust about The Great Big Rescued Food Cokk Off being held on 18 Oct 2023 Photo credit: Waiheke Gulf News

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: The Great Waiheke Radio Auckland Central Electorate Candidates Debate
item.description: The Great Waiheke Radio Auckland Central Electorate Candidates Debate. Held at Artworks Theatre on Thurs 28 September, 2023. The candidates were Mahesh Muralidhar (National), Oscar Sims (Labour) and Chloe Swarbrick (Green). Facilitated by Chris Walker.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Sir Peter Leitch - The Wayup Interview
item.description: Wayan and Jahn from Waiheke Radio's Wayup Show talk to the Mad Butcher, Sir Peter Leitch. Photo credit: Stuff

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Darleen Tana (Green) Candidate Interview
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Darleen Tana, Green candidate for The Tamaki Makaurau Māori electorate

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Hinurewa Te Hau (National) Candidate Interview
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Hinurewa Te Hau, National Party candidate for the Tamaki Makaurau Māori electorate

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Frank Lepera · Stoat Operations Manager Te Korowai o Waiheke
item.description: Greg Treadwell talks to Frank Lepera · Stoat Operations Manager at Te Korowai o Waiheke and gets an update on the progress in the project to eradicate stoats from the island.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Waiheke Radio Election Coverage
item.description: Greg Treadwell talks to Chris Walker about Waiheke Radio's 2023 general election coverage

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Damian Sycamore (TOP) candidate interview
item.description: Damian Sycamore is a Waiheke Islander. He is standing for The Opportunities Party (TOP) in the Auckland Central electorate. He spoke to Chris Walker about how TOP policies would address local Waiheke issues.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Oscar Sims Candidate Interview
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Oscar Sims, Labour candidate for Auckland Central

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Mahesh Muralidhar Candidate Interview
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Mahesh Muralidhar, National candidate for Auckland Central

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Peeni Henare Candidate Interview
item.description: Brent Simpson talks to Peeni Henare, Labour candidate for the Tamaki Makaurau electorate

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Chris Orange, Johnny Fleury and Steve Ingram Live at Waiheke Radio, May 2023
item.description: Chris Orange (bass), Johnny Fleury (chapman stick) and Steve Ingram (drums) perform live at Waiheke Library on Sat 27 May 2023 to mark NZ Music Month. Tracks performed: In the Dark; Origin; Toro; Crazy; Big Tide This Time; Politics Of Certainty

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Chloe Swarbrick Candidate Interview
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Chloe Swarbrick of the Green Party who is standing for re-election as the Auckland Central electorate MP.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: The Planters Live On Air
item.description: The Planters, Live on Waiheke Radio 25/08/2023

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Darleen Tana Interview
item.description: Koro Sciascia talks to Darleen Tana

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: The Anything Arty Show June 30th 2011
item.description: This week we had; a story from Waiheke Adult Literacy 2010 Programme Words, a conversation with Susi Newborn on her role in the Women in Film and TV NZ Organization, the release of the Chinese artist Ai WeiWei, an episode from the stories of Barry Pilton, the ever popular cinema competition, and ep 5 of our Great Gatsby serialisation

item.title: The Inspector
item.description: The inspectors lines replaced with a beep

item.title: Sybill

item.title: Eric

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Anything Arty - Interview with Artrist Goldsmith Part 1
item.description: An opportunity to listen to a conversation with Christine Hafermalz Wheeler, her husband David and Bernie Lee owner of Waiheke based builders Island 2000 talking about the building of David and Christine’s home, Citrine

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Anything Arty - The Artists Goldsmith Interview
item.description: Part 2 of an interview with Christine Hafermalz Wheeler, the Artist Goldsmith, sponsor of Waiheke Radio's The Anything Arty Show

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: THE ANYTHING ARTY SHOW FEB 9TH
item.description: This weeks arty show introduces new host Eve Bon and we looked at guns as a means of peace, the art of pasta, what’s on round the galleries and the Kermit challenge!

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: THE ANYTHING ARTY SHOW JAN 12 2012
item.description: This week a conversation with Chilean artist Margarita Degorret, a chance to hear from BMW design chief Chris Bangle on cars as art and a run through of the latest movies to play at Waiheke Community Cinema

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Anything Arty Show Jan 5 2012
item.description: This week: Comment on Fiona Pardington’s New Zealand Arts Foundation Laureate Award, Incubator interview with island artist Brett Oakes, Reading from author Rebecca Solnit on her essays The Distance Of Blue from A Field Guide To Getting Lost
